headline.title: Frequently Asked Questions about the Corona-Warn-App project

accordion.title: When will the app be available?
textblock: We are working with high priority to complete the application. Please understand that we cannot name a specific date. You can turn to the responsible federal ministry for this matter. However, the progression can be monitored in the code repository.

accordion.title: Where can I find information, ask questions or discuss topics regarding the Corona-Warn-App that are nót development related?
textblock: The Corona-Warn-App open-source project and its website corna-warn.app are concerned with the open-source development of the apps. Neither this website nor the GitHub repositories are the right place for discussion or information on topics unrelated to app development, like legal matters, end-user guidance, etc. For these, please visit/contact xyz.

accordion.title: Why open source?
textblock: We are convinced that the success of the solution depends on the users’ acceptance and trust. Through this open source approach, we want to create the transparency that is necessary for a strong foundation of trust. Furthermore, through this approach the broader public and their respective communities of experts have the possibility to actively contribute to the solution’s success via reviews and pull requests, for example.

accordion.title: How can developers contribute to this project?
textblock: The open source project uses GitHub, a worldwide famous online service in this field that provides software and developing projects on their own servers. All of those who are interested can participate in this project by, for example, correcting mistakes in the code, posting questions and comments about the project, or help with the documentation. The cooperation within the community is liable to a Code of Conduct. You can get started by learning more on contributing here.

accordion.title: Why will the project be hosted on GitHub and not on another platform?
textblock: We are convinced that GitHub is a well-established and respected platform for open source projects. It is the world’s biggest open source platform with more than 40 million users, over 100 million repositories of which over 30 million are publicly accessible. In case someone doesn’t want to create a GitHub account, there is the possibility to see the code without a GitHub account.

accordion.title: What Code of Conduct applies?
textblock: Only through mutual respect we can assure a successful development in a productive, collaborative community. All participants of the project community act on a Code of Conduct. All violations against it can be reported to the parties responsible for this project or to corona-warn-app.opensource@sap.com by all the members and this can entail consequences, like, warnings, or exclusions.
